data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Lahul & Spiti, Himachal Pradesh, India. Show them that faithfulness is better than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Lahul & Spiti, Himachal Pradesh, India

data.prayer: Lord, the believers in the county of Lahul & Spiti, Himachal Pradesh, India need teachers who can feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up.
data.verse: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

data.prayer: Spirit, sanctify the 348 believers in Lahul & Spiti and keep them blameless until Jesus returns.
data.verse: May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. May your whole spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. He who calls you is faithful, who will also do it.

data.prayer: Spirit, give faith and responsive hearts to the 31,600 citizens of the the county of Lahul & Spiti.
data.verse: Seek the Lord while he may be found; call upon him while he is near.

data.prayer: Father, I pray that the Sipi people will not be afraid or ashamed. Prevent them from being confounded or disappointed in their search for you. May the Sipi people know you.
Father, remind your church in Lahul & Spiti that they can know and depend on the love you have for them.
data.verse: We know and have believed the love which God has for us. God is love, and he who remains in love remains in God, and God remains in him.

data.prayer: Father, help the 348 believers in Lahul & Spiti to be spiritually intentional with their relationships among their 31,252 lost friends and neighbors.
Lord, help the people of Lahul & Spiti, Himachal Pradesh, India to discover the essence of being a disciple, making disciples, and how to plant churches that multiply.

location.name: Lahul & Spiti
location.people_groups_list: Sarera (Hindu traditions), Badhi (Hindu traditions), Chamar (Sikh traditions), Changgar, Gaddi (Hindu traditions)
